summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff regarding travel approval and logistical issues for a trip to Stockholm, Sweden, to conduct an interview for the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails detail frustrations over booking refundable flights and coordination problems, and reference several prior domestic trips for the same case.

persons.name: Budget
persons.context: An administrative staff member at the U.S. Attorney's Office involved in coordinating and booking travel for the legal team. They are communicating with M about flight options and hotel reservations.

connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) coordinating travel logistics for the Epstein investigation. Their communication shows a professional but strained working relationship due to travel booking errors.

events.title: Planned travel to Stockholm for interview
events.description: Travel by SDNY prosecutors/investigators to Stockholm, Sweden, to conduct an interview related to the Epstein investigation. The trip involves flights from JFK to Stockholm via Paris.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) was actively investigating the Epstein case (2018R01618) in early 2020, planning international travel to Sweden for an interview.
The investigation involved multiple domestic trips in 2019 to locations including Los Angeles, CA, and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, FL, for victim interviews and meetings.

Internal email correspondence reveals logistical challenges and frustrations within the SDNY team regarding booking refundable international flights, highlighting the operational aspects of the investigation.
The case is formally referenced as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
The document shows the investigation was ongoing and active well after Jeffrey Epstein's death, with prosecutors conducting witness interviews internationally.
